title: Happenings in the lakes area , Sept . 25 - Oct . 6
body_text:
The Detroit Lakes Tribune accepts community calendar items for publication online and, space permitting, in our Wednesday and Saturday print editions. Submissions must be made at least a week in advance of the event date, in writing, to either dltribune@dlnewspapers.com or vgerdes@dlnewspapers.com. Each submission must include the date, time and location of event, and where to go for more information (phone, email and/or website). Also include whether the event is free or paid admission, and how much it costs when applicable.
Wednesday, September 25
Advance Planning Seminars: David-Donehower Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes will be hosting two advance planning seminars, at noon and 5:30 p.m. Area residents are invited to join them for a light meal and presentations on advance funeral planning and the major changes in coverage anticipated for Medicare Part D plans in 2025. Both the presentation and meal are free and open to the public, but RSVPs are requested for planning purposes. Call 218-847-4147 to reserve your spot.
ADVERTISEMENT
Bucks Mill Dam Info Meeting: A public information meeting on the proposed modifications to the Bucks Mill Dam in Becker County will take place from 10 a.m. to noon at the Detroit Lakes office of the Pelican River Watershed District, located on the second floor of the Wells Fargo Bank building at 211 W. Holmes St. The project involves modifying the Bucks Mill Dam into a rock arch rapids and replacing the downstream culvert for fish passage. Moore Engineering staff will present information on the project and will be available to answer questions.
PRWD Water Management Rules Info Meeting: A public information meeting on proposed changes to the Pelican River Watershed District's water management rules will take place from 1-3 p.m. at the Detroit Lakes office of the Pelican River Watershed District, located on the second floor of the Wells Fargo Bank building at 211 W. Holmes St. Moore Engineering staff will present information on the proposed changes and will be available to answer questions.
Mid Central Door Open House: An open house is planned from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. in Mid Central Door's new location at 2661 Hwy. 10 West, Detroit Lakes. The event will begin with a ribbon cutting hosted by the Detroit Lakes Regional Chamber of Commerce Ambassadors. Free and open to the public.
Women's EDGE Workshop: The Detroit Lakes Regional Chamber of Commerce will be hosting the final presentation in its 2024 Women's EDGE Speaker Series, "Mentorship Mastery: A Path to Loving and Living Our Best Life," from 2-5 p.m. in the Venue at Meadows on Lind, 11457 U.S. Hwy. 59, Detroit Lakes. Renowned keynote speaker Brent Stromme will kick off the workshop with a presentation on the power of mentorship, assisted by expert facilitators Missy Wokasch and Karen Pifher. Cost is $60 per person if you are just registering for this event; if you purchased your ticket as part of the speaker series package, there is no additional fee. Register online at business.visitdetroitlakes.com/events or call 218-847-9202.
Pavilion Open House: The Detroit Lakes Pavilion, located at 1361 Washington Ave., will host a public open house from 4-7 p.m., for area residents to come see the current state of the building and learn more about the planned November referendum for City Park improvements (including the Pavilion). Go to cityofdetroitlakes.com/pavilion to learn more.
Methodist Meatball Supper: Detroit Lakes United Methodist Church will be hosting a meatball supper from 4:30-7 p.m. To-go meals will be prepared for pickup only; no on-site dining. The meal includes two meatballs, mashed potatoes and gravy, a roll, green beans, coleslaw and dessert. Cost is $15 per meal; cash, check or credit cards accepted. The church is located at 885 Pembina Trail, Detroit Lakes.
Open Acoustic Jam: Bring your acoustic instruments to the Detroit Lakes Public Library for an unplugged jam session, starting at 5 p.m. All experience levels are welcome to this supportive and family-friendly event. Free and open to the public. Bring your acoustic instrument and come have some fun!
ADVERTISEMENT
Try Hockey for Free: The Detroit Lakes Youth Hockey Association is hosting a free "Discover Hockey" event at Kent Freeman Arena in Detroit Lakes from 5:30 to 7 p.m. Beginner skaters between ages 4-9 are welcome to come learn about the basics of skating and the most important life lessons hockey can offer, like learning to get up after a fall. This is a come-and-go event; no registration necessary. All are welcome; a limited number of skates and equipment are available to test the ice for yourself. Questions? Contact Joe Schiller at joeschiller26@hotmail.com for more information.
Live Music: Tim Stoll and Carrie LeDoux at Sunnyside Care Center in rural Lake Park, 1:30-3 p.m.; live piano music at Parallel 46 in Cormorant from 6-8 p.m.
Thursday, September 26
Jess Lourey Author Visit: The Detroit Lakes Public Library will host a 2 p.m. visit by Minnesota author Jess Lourey in its main meeting room at 1000 Washington Ave. Hear about Lourey's experiences as the author of an acclaimed series of true crime-inspired mystery novels and get the scoop on her latest book, "The Reaping." This program is offered free of charge thanks in part to funding from the Minnesota Arts and Cultural Heritage Fund.
Retirement Finance Seminar: Join financial advisor Matthew Ratchenski at the Mid Minnesota Federal Credit Union, 1405 U.S. Hwy. 10, Detroit Lakes, from 5:30-6:30 p.m. for a retirement finance seminar, "Understanding Your Rollover Options," and learn your options for handling your employer-based retirement plan when leaving a company or retiring. To register for this seminar, or for more information, please contact Detroit Lakes Community Education at 218-847-4418.
Traveling Art Pub: Bucks Mill Brewing in downtown Detroit Lakes will host a visit by the Traveling Art Pub from 6-8:30 p.m. Anyone age 16 and up is invited to come create a 16x20-inch acrylic painting of a "Pink Wish Sky," while eating, drinking and socializing with friends and family. Cost is $43.50 per person, and includes all supplies. Preregistration is required; sign up online at thetravelingartpub.com to reserve your spot for this guided painting session.
Lake Park Outdoor Movie: A special outdoor screening of the Halloween classic, "Hocus Pocus," will take place on the lawn of Wagner Insurance Agency in downtown Lake Park, starting at 7 p.m. Admission is a free will offering, and concessions will be available. Proceeds from the event will go to the Lake Park Pool Fund. Open to the public.
Six Appeal: World champion a capella vocal ensemble, Six Appeal, will be bringing their beautiful harmonies to the stage of Detroit Lakes' Historic Holmes Theatre for a 7:30 p.m. show. Tickets are $22 for adults, $10 for students, and may be purchased online at dlccc.org/holmes-theatre.html, or you can call 218-844-7469 to reserve your spot.
ADVERTISEMENT
Friday, September 27
Otter Cove Play Day at Lincoln Ed: Staff from the Otter Cove Children's Museum in Fergus Falls will be at Lincoln Education Center, 204 E. Willow St., Detroit Lakes, from 8:30-11:15 a.m. for a morning of art activities, sensory stations, fine motor and tabletop activities, tunnels, soft climbers for infants and toddlers, and more, hosted by Detroit Lakes Community Education. Free to attend, but preregistration is required. Sign up online at dlschools.arux.app (under ECFE) to reserve your child's spot.
Lake Park Pumpkin Carving, Biggest Pumpkin and Yard Decor Contests: Prior to Lake Park's annual Pumpkin Fest celebration, festival organizers will be announcing the winners of the community's Biggest Pumpkin, Pumpkin Carving and Yard Decor competitions. Weigh-in for biggest pumpkin will take place from 5-7 p.m. at the Lake Park City Center, which is also where the pumpkin carving competition will take place. Judging for the yard decor contest will be at 7 p.m., with cash prizes given away for first, second and third place.
Grand Funk Railroad: American rock icons Grand Funk Railroad will be at Mahnomen's Shooting Star Casino for an 8 p.m. concert in the Event Center. Tickets start at $38 and may be purchased online at starcasino.com or by calling 800-453-7827.
Live Music: Jamie Holt at the Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30-9 p.m.; Rachael Ianiro at American Legion Post 15 in Detroit Lakes, 8-11 p.m.; Brianna Helbling at Shooting Star Casino's Mustang Lounge in Mahnomen, 8 p.m.-12:30 a.m.; Rustic the Band at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.
Saturday, September 28
Lake Park Pumpkin Fest: The community of Lake Park will host its annual Pumpkin Fest celebration, starting with a craft and vendor show from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. in the Lake Park-Audubon High School Gymnasium. There will also be a Pumpkin Brunch Bake Off from 9-11:30 a.m. in the Lake Park Fire Hall; a car show from 9 a.m.-2:30 p.m. on Main Street; a 5k trail walk/fun run and one-mile youth trail run, both starting at 9 a.m.; and a parade at 3:30 p.m. (lineup starts at 3 p.m.). Visit the Lake Park Pumpkin Fest Facebook page for more information, including any scheduling changes that may occur.
American Adventure Opening Day: The Becker County Museum in Detroit Lakes will be celebrating the opening of its new traveling exhibit, "American Adventure," at 10 a.m. This 3,000-square-foot, interactive history exhibit will be located on the museum's basement level, and consists of a realistic, "choose-your-adventure" maze where visitors can learn about one of America's earliest pioneer settlements, Jamestown, Virginia, and see if they have what it takes to survive under the conditions that the settlers experienced back in 1607. The exhibit will be at the museum through the end of the 2024-25 school year. General admission is $20 for adults, $10 for kids (museum members receive a 50% discount). There are also group rates and pre-visit lesson plans available for student tours. Contact the museum at 218-847-2938 or visit the exhibit's Facebook event page for more information.
Kids Carnival Fundraiser: Early Birds and Night Owls Child Care is hosting a kids' carnival fundraiser from 10 a.m.-5 p.m. at Zion Lutheran Church, 1100 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes. The event will include games, a raffle, craft vendor booths and more, with proceeds going to help the local childcare provider open a second location.
ADVERTISEMENT
Sunflower Wall Hanging Workshop: The Detroit Lakes Public Library, located at 1000 Washington Ave., will host a free art workshop with the library's own Brenda Labine, who will teach attendees how to make their own sunflower wall hanging, and possibly discover a new hobby. No cost to attend, but preregistration is required. Sign up online at larl.org/events to reserve your spot.
Live Music: Karaoke at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store, 8-11 p.m.; R&R at the Roadhouse in Cormorant, 8-11 p.m.; Brianna Helbling at Shooting Star Casino's Mustang Lounge in Mahnomen, 8 p.m.-12:30 a.m.; Martin Drive at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.
Sunday, September 29
Tamarac Fall Festival: The Tamarac National Wildlife Refuge in rural Detroit Lakes will host its annual festival from 12-4 p.m., with activities centered around the Refuge's Visitor Center and nearby Discovery Center. There will be guided hikes and nature-themed activity stations, and live raptors from The Nature Connection in Blackduck, Minnesota, will be on site for a little one-on-one interaction. Some healthy snacks will also be served. Open to the public. Call 218-847-2641, visit fws.gov/refuge/tamarac or check the Refuge's Facebook page for more information on this event.
Monday, September 30
Genealogy for Beginners: Discover your roots with a little help from the Detroit Lakes Public Library at this 5 p.m. beginner workshop, which will introduce attendees to the free genealogy databases available at the library. No cost to attend, but pre-registration is required. Sign up online at larl.org/events , call 218-847-2168 or stop by the library at 1000 Washington Ave. to reserve your spot.
Tuesday, October 1
Break the Silence Memorial Display Opens: The Lakes Crisis and Resource Center of Detroit Lakes is bringing back its Break the Silence Memorial Display to the Detroit Lakes City Park for public viewing, starting today at 8 a.m. and continuing through Oct. 13. This display during Domestic Violence Awareness Month highlights Minnesota victims of intimate partner murder from September 2023-August 2024, honoring and remembering them in a respectful way. Event booklets are available at the park, or you can also pick one up at the LCRC offices on Pelican Lane.
Master Gardener Talk: Becker County Master Gardener Nick Williams will be discussing "Atypical Tree Choices for Landscapes" in a 12 p.m. presentation at the Detroit Lakes Public Library Library, 1000 Washington Ave. Free and open to all area adults and students in grades 6-12.
Meet Author Douglas Wood: The Detroit Lakes Public Library will be hosting a 2 p.m. visit from Minnesota author Douglas Wood, who will talk about his new memoir, "A Wild Path," as well as his experiences as an author, artist, Musician, naturalist and wilderness guide. Free and open to the public, thanks in part to funding from the Minnesota Legacy Arts and Cultural Heritage Fund.
ADVERTISEMENT
After School STEAM Club Opens: The Becker County Museum will host an After School STEAM Club for students in grades 2-5 on Tuesdays, Oct. 1-Dec. 17, from 3:30-5:15 p.m. Activities will include hands-on projects and STEAM (science, technology, engineering, art and math) learning. Class fee is $225, which includes a small snack and supplies for each week's session, but transportation must be provided separately. Sign up online at beckercountyhistory.org/store to reserve your child's spot.
Cyber Safety Workshop: CornerStone Youth and Community Center of Frazee will host a free seminar on "Cyber Safety and Digital Citizenship at 7:30 p.m. in the Frazee High School Media Center at 305 Lake St. North, Frazee. All are welcome.
Wednesday, October 2
Cookies and Crooks Presentation: Join Midwest Bank and the Detroit Lakes Regional Chamber of Commerce at the Historic Holmes Theatre's Midwest Bank Ballroom for one of two "Cookies and Crooks" presentations on common scams targeting consumers and businesses, featuring a special agent from Homeland Security Investigations. The presentations will begin at 10 a.m. and 2 p.m., and will last approximately 90 minutes each. Though this event is free and open to the public (not just Midwest Bank customers), an RSVP is requested for planning purposes. Contact Midwest Bank at 218-847-4771 or the Chamber at 218-847-9202 to reserve your spot.
Writers Group: Writers and prospective writers seeking encouragement, feedback and collaboration are welcome to join the Detroit Lakes Public Library's Writers' Group, which meets at the library at 3 p.m. All genres of writing are welcome. If you have any questions, send an email to detroit@larl.org or call 218-847-2168.
Traveling Art Pub: Billy's Corner Bar in Vergas will host a visit by the Traveling Art Pub from 6-8:30 p.m. Anyone age 16 and up is invited to come create a 16x20-inch acrylic painting of a fall sunset on the lake, while eating, drinking and socializing with friends and family. Cost is $43.50 per person, and includes all supplies. Preregistration is required; sign up online at thetravelingartpub.com to reserve your spot for this guided painting session.
Live Music: Come to Parallel 46 in Cormorant from 6-8 p.m. for some live piano music. Open to the public.
Thursday, October 3
ECFE Night at the Library: Detroit Lakes Early Childhood Family Education will join Eliza the librarian for a night of stories and activities at the Detroit Lakes Public Library, 1000 Washington Ave., from 5:30-6:15 p.m. Free and open to the public. Call the library at 218-847-2168 for more information.
ADVERTISEMENT
After Hours Book Club: The Detroit Lakes Public Library's After Hours Book Club will meet at Buck Mills Brewing, 824 Washington Ave., starting at 7 p.m. The group will discuss the novel, "You're Invited" by Amanda Jayatissa, which takes place during a Sri Lankan wedding, where the bride goes missing and all the guest have their own secrets. All are welcome, even if you haven't read the book. If you have any questions, feel free to send an email to detroit@larl.org or call 218-847-2168.
Friday, October 4
Tailgate for Troops: United Community Bank of Frazee will be hosting a "Tailgate for Troops" event prior to the Frazee-Vergas High School Homecoming game at the F-V football fields, from 5-7 p.m. Food, games and fun for all, with proceeds from the free will offering dinner to benefit the Honor Flight of Minnesota and North Dakota. Open to the public.
Live Music: Rachael Ianiro at the Sandbar II in Detroit Lakes, 6:30-9 p.m.; Smokin' Amp DJ at the Detroit Lakes Holiday Inn, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.
Saturday, October 5
Taste of Lund: The congregation of Lund Lutheran Church in rural Detroit Lakes invites the public to enjoy its 19th Annual Taste of Lund Festival, starting at 9 a.m. Enjoy Scandinavian delicacies including rommegrot, sand bakkels, Swedish almond cake, rosettes, krumkake and more; samples are two for $1, and you can also purchase some items at the bake sale to take home with you. Open to the public. The church is located nine miles north of Detroit Lakes on Richwood Road. Call 218-847-9662.
Winter Gear Giveaway: Detroit Lakes' Trinity Lutheran Church will host a Winter Gear Giveaway from 9 a.m.-1 p.m. Students from preschool through high school age are invited to come in and pick up one of each of the following – winter jackets, snow pants, boots, hats, mittens/gloves and sweatshirts, at no cost. The church is located at 1401 Madison Ave.
DMRA Mountain Market: Detroit Mountain Recreation Area will host an outdoor arts and crafts market from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. More than 32 artisans, crafters and other vendors will be on hand for the event, which is open to the public.
Free Morning Matinee: Odyssey Washington Square Cinema 7 will host a free screening of the family-friendly, animated comedy movie, "Migration," at 10 a.m. No tickets will be issued for this free show, as seating is on a first-come, first-served basis. Doors and concessions open at 9:30 a.m.
Frazee Craft and Vendor Show: The 4 Corners Lions Club will host the 46th Craft and Vendor Show at Frazee Elementary School in Frazee from 10 a.m.-3 p.m. More than 60 booths will be featured. Open to the public; lunch will be available for purchase.
Applefest: The Gottenborg Apple Orchard in rural Audubon (20074 Audubon Lake Road) will host an apple festival from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. The day will begin with the sorting of apples for processing from 10 a.m.-12 p.m., followed by the pressing and distribution of fresh apple cider from 12-4 p.m., pork barbecue sandwiches with apple slaw (the barbecuing will take place during the event), and live acoustic music from Wayne McArthur, 2-5 p.m.
Damien Fall Home Tour: The Damien Society will host its 43rd Annual Fall Home Tour from 12:30-4 p.m. Tickets for this fundraiser for area charities are $25 in advance or $30 on the day of the event, available at Central Market and the Chamber of Commerce as well as from Damien members. Tickets can also be purchased using the QR code on Home Tour posters or via a link on the Damien Society Facebook page. Four homes in the Detroit Lakes area will be featured on this tour, including one on Frazee's Wymer Lake. No children under the age of 10 will be allowed to attend, and those over the age of 10 must have a ticket to be admitted. Shoes should be left at the door of each home; no bare feet, please.
"New Hobby" Embroidery Workshop: The staff of the Detroit Lakes Public Library invites all area residents to come to the library at 3 p.m. and "Jump into a New Hobby" with artist Linda Norland, who will explore the colorful world of embroidery. Workshop will run for approximately an hour. There is no cost to attend, but pre-registration is required. Sign up online at larl.org/events or call 218-847-2168 to reserve your spot.
Richville UMC Spaghetti Supper: The congregation of Richville United Methodist Church invites the public to enjoy a spaghetti supper, complete with root beer floats and live music, from 5-7 p.m. Cost is a free-will offering, with proceeds going to replace the church's carpet.
Beer, Brats and Brass: Brass and percussion musicians from the Fargo-Moorhead Symphony Orchestra will be in the Midwest Bank Ballroom at the Historic Holmes Theatre from 6-8 p.m., performing a mixture of jazz, classical and funk music, as well as a polka or two. This Oktoberfest-style celebration will also include beer and brats for purchase. Tickets are available for purchase at dlccc.org/holmes-theatre.html, by phone at 218-844-7469, or in person at the Holmes Box Office, 806 Summit Ave., Detroit Lakes.
Live Music: Jamie Holt at Al's Bar and Grill/Audubon Liquor Store from 8-11 p.m.; Karaoke with Kelly Reller at Zorbaz in Detroit Lakes, 9 p.m.-1 a.m.
Sunday, October 6
Knights Pancake Breakfast: The Knights of Columbus will be sponsoring a pancake/French toast and sausage breakfast in the Holy Rosary Parish Center, 1043 Lake Ave., Detroit Lakes, from 8 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Open to the public.
Tamarac Sunday Movie: A free screening of the family-friendly, nature-themed movie, "Beavers: The Biggest Dam Movie You Ever Saw," will be held at 2 p.m. in the Visitor Center at Tamarac National Wildlife Refuge. Take an intimate swim with beavers and experience the rich aquatic habitat of one of nature’s greatest engineers. Run time is approximately 38 minutes; all are welcome. Call 218-847-2641, visit fws.gov/refuge/tamarac or check the Refuge's Facebook page for more information on this event.
Blessing of the Animals: An ecumenical pet blessing service hosted by Detroit Lakes' United Methodist Church, Congregational United Church of Christ and St. Luke's Episcopal Church will take place at St. Luke's, starting at 3:30 p.m. The church is located at 1400 Corbett Road, Detroit Lakes. There will be blessings, songs and treats for both humans and their pets. All creatures great and small are welcome, but pets should be kept leashed or in carriers. Pet photos and stuffed animals may also be included in the blessing. Open to the public. Donations are encouraged, not required, with proceeds to benefit the Marshmallow Animal Shelter in Detroit Lakes.
Multi-day and Recurring Events
Winter Gear and Consignment Ski Swap: The main lodge at Detroit Mountain Recreation Area will host a winter gear and consignment ski swap, benefiting the Detroit Mountain Ski Patrol, during the weekend of Oct. 6-8. Anyone can drop off their used winter gear, skiing and snowboarding equipment between 12-8 p.m. on Friday, Oct. 4. Items can be offered as a donation to the Ski Patrol, or sold by consignment. Sale hours will be from 9 a.m.-4 p.m. on Saturday and 10 a.m.-2 p.m. on Sunday.
Maplewood Leaf Days: Come and celebrate autumn during Leaf Days at Maplewood State Park, which will take place on two consecutive weekends, Sept. 28-29 and Oct. 5-6. The Friends of Maplewood annual gathering is an excellent opportunity to see the park strut its dynamic fall colors and participate in family-fun activities, which take place from 10 a.m.-3 p.m. on Saturday and Sunday during both weekends. Enter the park at 39721 Park Entrance Road, Pelican Rapids. The event is free but requires a current Minnesota State Park vehicle pass. If you don’t already have one, please purchase a permit ahead of time at dnr.state.mn.us/state_parks/permit.html rather than at the Ranger Station, to streamline your visit.
"Women Create" Exhibit: The New York Mills Regional Cultural Center’s new gallery exhibit, “Women Create,” will be displayed through Oct. 12, showcasing the work of three local painters and sculptors, including Linda Beilke of Frazee, and Linda Sheryak and Donna Chalimonczyk of Moorhead. The paintings and sculptures in “Women Create” will be available for purchase, though the exhibit itself is free and open to the public. Hours are 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Fridays and 10 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturdays. Private viewings can be arranged anytime by calling Cheryl Bannes at 218-385-3339 or emailing cheryl@kulcher.org. For more information, visit kulcher.org or call the Cultural Center at 218-385-3339.
Otter Berry Corn Maze: Come to Otter Berry Farm in rural New York Mills and enjoy its 6-acre, interactive corn maze, with over 50 varieties of pumpkins, gourds and squash along with tons of fun activities for the whole family, including a petting zoo, tractors to climb on, and plenty of games to play. The maze will be open every Saturday and Sunday through Oct. 27, and is handicap accessible. Hours are 11 a.m.-5:30 p.m. Saturdays, and 1-5 p.m . Sundays. No smoking, and no pets allowed. Admission is $12 for everyone age 5 and up, free for kids age 4 and under, except for the Night Maze, which is $15 for all ages. Pumpkins and concessions will be available for an additional charge; prices subject to change. Extended hours during MEA weekend, Oct. 18-20. Visit otterberryfarm.com/corn-maze-pumpkin-patch for more information.
Shady Hollow Flea Market: The Shady Hollow Flea Market is open from 7 a.m.-3 p.m. every Saturday through the end of September. For more information visit shadyhollowfleamarket.com online or call 602-809-6661.
Farmers Market: The Lakes Area Farmers Market will be open every Tuesday and Saturday through the end of September in Detroit Lakes' Peoples Park from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. Come shop with your favorite returning vendors, or discover some new ones, until 1 p.m. Vendors accept EBT cards and food checks to be used for fresh fruit and vegetables. Go to lakesareafarmersmarket.info for more information.
Master Gardening Clinics: The Becker County Master Gardeners will host their weekly Plant, Pest and Gardening Clinics, every Wednesday through the end of September, 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at the local University of Minnesota Extension Office, which is located at 1120 8th St. SE in Detroit Lakes. Bring your plant, pest, disease or gardening questions to them for helpful solutions and ideas. Samples would be helpful for answering specific questions. For more information, including what types of samples are needed, call 218-846-7328, extension 7105.
Sleeping Bags Needed: The Holy Rosary Knights of Columbus in Detroit Lakes are collecting sleeping bags for distribution to those in need. Anyone who has a new or used, functional sleeping bag (i.e., the zipper works) can drop them off at the Becker County Food Pantry, 610 Terry St., Detroit Lakes, anytime between 8 a.m.-3 p.m. on Tuesdays and Thursdays. For more information contact Brad Carlson at 218-234-4448.
Grace Cafe: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be serving lunch every Wednesday from 12-1 p.m. The lunch is open to all in the Detroit Lakes area; admission is a free-will donation. Guests are welcome to stay after the meal to play games or cards.
Grace Food Pantry: Grace Lutheran Church in Detroit Lakes will be operating a food pantry during its regular office hours, 9 a.m.- noon Monday through Friday. Anyone in need can come in and pick up some food. Donations will also be accepted.
Library Storytime: The Detroit Lakes Public Library offers weekly Preschool Storytime sessions every Thursday at 10:30 a.m. Preschoolers and their caregivers/families are invited to join library staff for stories, flannel boards, finger plays, songs and more. This early literacy experience explores a different theme each week and is a way to encourage young children to enjoy reading. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Celebrate Recovery: The Celebrate Recovery group meets every Tuesday, 6:30-8 p.m. at Christian Fellowship Church, 28048 Meadow Drive, Detroit Lakes, to take the next steps on the "Road to Recovery: Eight Principles Based on the Beatitudes, Twelve Steps and their Biblical Comparison." Many struggle with alcoholism, divorce, sexual abuse, codependency, domestic violence, drug addiction, food and gambling addictions. Celebrate Recovery is a tried and proven format to help you walk through life's struggles. Men and women meet in a large group format, then break off into smaller discussion groups; men with men, women with women. Come as you are. No cost. We are here to help. Unfortunately, no childcare is available at this time. For more information, check out the website at celebraterecovery.com or call us at 218-234-2496.
Caring Cup Grief Support: The Caring Cup, a gathering of community members who are dealing with the loss of a loved one, will meet at the David-Donehower Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on the second Wednesday of every month; the Furey Funeral Home in Frazee on every third Wednesday, and West-Kjos Funeral Home in Detroit Lakes on every fourth Wednesday. All meetings take place from 10:30 to 11:30 a.m., and offer a relaxed time to face the challenges of life after loss, together. For more information, call Mary Swenson at 218-847-4147.
TOPS Meeting: The local chapter of Take Off Pounds Sensibly (TOPS) meets weekly on Thursday mornings at Trinity Lutheran Church, 1401 Madison Ave., Detroit Lakes. Weigh-in begins at 8:20 a.m., meeting at 9 a.m. Contact Carol at 218-841-0226 or Coleen at 218-841-2877 for more information. All are welcome; first session is free.
Trivia Nights: Lakeside Tavern in Detroit Lakes hosts a Trivia Night every Monday from 7 to 9 p.m. Event takes place in Lakeside Tavern's upstairs space, so seating is limited. Open to the public.
GED/Adult Diploma Instruction: If finishing high school is still on your “to-do” list, it is never too late!! Lakes Area Adult Education is open and ready to help you meet your goals. Orientation sessions for GED or Adult Diploma classes take place twice a month, so get in touch and get started now! Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us. Additional Adult Education offerings and associated flyers can always be found at dlschools.net/departments/community-education.
Free ESL Instruction: Free English as a Second Language instruction is offered for adults in the Detroit Lakes Area, every Monday through Thursday (holidays excepted) at Lakes Area Adult Education. The schedule is flexible and individualized. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information. Additional Adult Education offerings and associated flyers can always be found at dlschools.net/departments/community-education.
Minnesota Driver's License Exam Preparation: Detroit Lakes Adult Basic Education offers virtual classes that are designed to help unlicensed adult drivers become familiar with vocabulary, signs and rules of the road so they can successfully pass the written portion of the Minnesota Driver’s License Exam. Call 218-844-5760 or email slandsem@detlakes.k12.mn.us for more information. Additional Adult Education offerings and associated flyers can always be found at communityed.dlschools.net.
DL Cloggers: The DL Cloggers meet to dance and socialize every Tuesday (excluding holidays) at 1 p.m. in the basement of Detroit Lakes VFW Post 1676. No prior dance experience necessary. For more information, call Ruby at 218-847-7741.
HR Connect: The Detroit Lakes Chamber is hosting an opportunity for human resources professionals, business owners and managers to connect, every first Thursday of the month at 8:15 a.m. at the Chamber office at 700 Summit Ave. Discuss human resource topics, share best practices and review data to help attract, retain and grow the workforce for the lakes region. Event is free for Chamber members, $10 for non-members.
Baby Bounce: Songs, stories, and action poems for infants, toddlers and their caregivers are offered every Monday at the Detroit Lakes Public Library at 10:30 a.m. Program runs about a half hour including playtime and chatting with other caregivers. For ages 0-18 months. Call 218-847-2168 for more information.
Alcoholics Anonymous: Detroit Lakes' Alano Club meets at 827 Summit Ave. on the following days and times: Sundays at 1 p.m., 12x12 open meeting; Tuesdays at 7 p.m., Big Book open meeting; Wednesdays at noon, Grapevine open meeting; Wednesdays at 6 p.m., women's open meeting; Thursdays at 7 p.m., Intro to AA open meeting; Saturdays at 7 a.m., men's open meeting; Saturdays at 9 a.m., Women's Big Book closed meeting; Saturdays at 8 p.m., open topic meeting. There are no dues or fees for meetings. For more information, call 218-844-9970 or the District 3 AA Helpline at 877-833-2327.
